questions.question: The drive to switch to electric cars is to be accomplished by the year
questions.answer: Paragraph 1; The drive to switch to electric cars went a mile further last Wednesday when Britain joined France in pledging to end the sale of new gas and diesel cars by 2040.

questions.question: The reason for the drive is
options: ~Cars are major polluters
=Cars powered by gasoline or diesel are major polluters
~Cars are too many
~None of the above
questions.answer: Paragraph 2; Cars powered by gasoline or diesel are major polluters

questions.question: A major cause for the loss of faith in diesel as a more environmentally friendly fuel was
options: ~The BMW Scandal
~The advent of electric cars into the market
=The Volkswagen Emissions Scandal
~Diesel generates large quantities of health threatening nitrogen – oxide
questions.answer: Paragraph 2; The Volkswagen emissions scandal in the United States put to rest the long standing European faith in diesel as a more environmentally friendly fuel, not least because it generates large quantities of health-threatening nitrogen oxides.

questions.question: The measure of the success is dependent upon where the electricity comes from because
options: ~If the source is coal-fired plants, there is a net increase in greenhouse gases
~If the source is natural gas plants, there is a modest net increase in greenhouse gases
~If the source is carbon-free sources like water, wind and solar power, there is a huge net benefit
=All of the above
questions.answer: Paragraph 4; Much depends, too, on where the electricity comes from. If it comes from coal-fired plants, there could be a net increase in the greenhouse gases that are warming the planet; if from natural gas plants, a modest net decrease; if from carbon-free sources like wind and solar power, a huge net benefit

questions.question: An obvious indication of the level of difficulty which will be faced in making this shift is
options: President Trump’s antagonism to the Paris climate accord
Volvo’s announcement that it will make only electric and hybrid cars as of 2019
Need for increased infrastructure to accommodate thousands of new charging points, upgrade in generating capacity etc
None of the above

questions.question: Britain, France and others are spurring further innovation with the objectives of
options: lowering the prices
address the issues of relatively limited range
address the issue of long charging times
all of the above
questions.answer: Paragraph 5; The targets set by Britain, France and others are bound to spur further innovation that will lower prices and address the greatest weaknesses of plug-in cars: relatively limited range and long charging times.

questions.question: A good way to raise public consciousness about reducing greenhouse gasses is
options: Banning the use of fossil fuels
Putting more electric cars on the streets
Increasing the taxes levied on fossil fuels
None of the above
questions.answer: Paragraph 6; Most people do not spend a lot of time thinking about how their electricity is generated, but they are likely to notice a plugged-in car on their street and, eventually, improvements in air quality. Once people are aware of that, they could well support shifts to cleaner fuels in other forms of transport, like planes and trains.
